converse.line: Hi. Do you just like greeting strangers, or is there something you need?

choice.line: I'm taking a quick survey. What's your favorite color?
Mine's magenta, the color of a refreshing glass of Pixie, the ultimate citrus drink.
How kind of you to ask! It's been alright, but I haven't had my Mr. Thyme yet today. I'm missing that flavor sensation of 23 flavors. You have one, by chance?
No, I don't. (It's like she's advertising the product.)
What's the latest news around here?
They're finally selling Loco-soda around here! I'm glad they brought such a classic soda back into the market. Thanks, Lambda Drinks Corporation!
(I meant like actual news, but okay.)

converse.line: I do own the name, yes.
I've been talking with Jacques, and I'm here to convince you to take over the company.
You know, I'd LOVE to take it over, but I feel like I won't be the best person for the position. I've seen the other candidates, and I realize I'm out of my league.
That's not true. In fact, you're pretty much the only one Jacques was considering for taking the position.
Nah, that can't be. Who'd want a poor girl to fill a rich man's job? Besides, despite me knowing a lot about the company, I have no experience.
But Pierre's looking for someone with determination, loyalty, and enthusiasm, exactly the qualities you possess. Didn't he tell you this when you went in for an interview?

I never interviewed. Jacques was trying to get me to come but I wouldn't. He isn't the best at persuading. But you, you've done and convinced me to apply for my dream position. Thanks! I'm going to apply now!
I'll come with you. I've got to speak with Pierre too.
Let's see what he says. I really, really, really hope I'll make it.

random.line: How's working at your favorite company?
It's fantastic! I am currently learning about the economics and fundamentals of business at a local college. I get more and more excited for my future job every day.
I've never seen anybody as enthusiastic for a management job as you.
You learn the secret recipe yet?
I've learned steps 1 to 5 of a 42 step process. It's so complicated, I'm having trouble imagining how Pierre came up with it.
I see you are working hard.
Yep! All while enjoying a refreshing Zesti, the best cola manufactured on all the planet.
You should be head of the advertising department as well. You're good.
